	As I understand it Kazu-uchi mono were tempered and complete 
swords. The =
rules about signatures are general, mediocre works are 
rarely seen with th=
e "full" signatures, however sometimes a well made 
sword may be seen with =
the "plain" mei.
>	I would also think that a "kazu-uchi tanto"=DD is an 
>o=
xymoron,kazu-uchi works were all katana or wakizashi.Tanto I have 
>always =
been told command more skill and tend to focus the talents of 
>the smith, =
the presence of a "kazu-uchi mei" on one of these would, 
>I think, be of l=
ittle concern. I have seen several excellent 
>Kiyomitsu tanto with just a =
two character mei.
